title: How Boris Johnson's big Brexit deal week could leave him forced by MPs to agree to a delay
text:
After Sir Oliver Letwin's successful amendment on Saturday forced Boris Johnson to comply with his legal duty to seek a Article 50 extension, he hopes to give European leaders no reason to grant any further delay to Brexit by getting his deal through in the next few days.

Sir Oliver may have insisted over the weekend that he was "absolutely behind the government now" and promised "no more" amendments from him, but that does not mean the rest of his colleagues will be similarly helpful.

Here is how this week could leave the Prime Minister with no option but to see Brexit delayed.

What about that meaningful vote?

Ministers urged Parliament not to use its rare Saturday sitting to "render tonight's...
